title: Normal probability of certificate given hours

content.description: The distribution of number of hours worked by volunteers last year at a large hospital is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>7</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. Volunteers in the top <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of hours worked will receive a certificate of merit.
content.question: If a volunteer from last year is selected at random, which of the following is closest to the probability that the volunteer selected will receive a certificate of merit given that the number of hours the volunteer worked is less than <math alttext="90" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
